DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this Phase III trial is to confirm the efficacy of intravaginal dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA) in postmenopausal women with vaginal atrophy.
DOC.brief_title: DHEA Against Vaginal Atrophy - 3-Month Efficacy Study
DOC.criteria: Main Postmenopausal women (hysterectomized or nonhysterectomized) Women between 40 and 75 years of age. Willing to participate in the study and sign an informed consent. Women who have selfidentified symptom(s)of vaginal atrophy. For nonhysterectomized women, willing to have endometrial biopsy at screening and end of study. Main Undiagnosed abnormal genital bleeding. Hypertension equal to or above 140/90 mm Hg. The administration of any investigational drug within 30 days of screening visit. Endometrial hyperplasia, cancer or endometrial histology showing proliferative, secretory or menstrual type characteristics at histologic evaluation of endometrial biopsy performed at screening.
